thesis.description: An investigation has been made of the Stark effect in the region of the mercury spectrum from 2200 - 3000 A. Using a modified Lo Surdo source, fields of the order of 80,000 volts per centimeter huve been obtained. Plates have been taken with a Hilger E2 spectrograph and a Hilger E1 quartz spectrograph. [...]

thesis.description: "Mais si tu n'obéis point à la voix de l'Eternel, ton Dieu ... voici toutes les malédictions qui viendront sur toi et qui seront ton partage ... tu seras maudit, à ton arrivée,et tu saras maudit à ton départ ... il n'y aura personne pour venir à ton secours ... tu seras tous les jours opprimé et écrasé. Et tu seras un sujet d'étonnemant, de sarcasme etde raillerie parmi tous les peuples chez qui l'Eternal te mènera ... tu seras. arraché du pays dont tu vas entrer en possession. L'Eternal te dispersera parmi tous les peuples,d'une extremité de la terre a 1' autre ··" [...]

thesis.description: Cyclopropane derivatives first attracted attention in connection with ring strain studies. These compounds formed the subjects of a large number of papers on ring stability, but a continued study of the effect of ring opening reagents revealed that, not only did substituent groups affect the ease with which the ring-opened, but, what was of considerablygreater interest, they exercised a marked influence on the way in which the ring opened. Phenyl groups particularly were effective in this way, and have often given unexpected results. [...]

thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Delta-ketonic esters.

thesis.description: During the past few years two methods of extracting Lignin from the woody fibre have been developed in these laboratories. R.J. Rowley (1) extracted the lignin by means of ethylene glycol containing a trace of hydrochloric acid. The glycol-lignin thus obtained had not apparently undergone any appreciable change in structure but as a material for further work it suffered from one defect: in determining the Methoxyl content by the Method of Zeisel, a part of the glycol-residue, attached to the Lignin, is reduced to ethyl iodide and hence renders this value somewhat uncertain. On this account H.Hibbert and F. Brauns replaced the ethylene glycol by absolute methyl alcohol and obtained under otherwise similar conditions a Methyl-alcohol-lignin which differs from the glycol-lignin only in having a methexyl, in place of an hydroxy-ethoxyl radicle. [...]
thesis.creator: Mackinney, Herbert William.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: A study on the structure of lignin.

thesis.description: Perhaps more than any other phase of economic questions, the theories dealing with international trade and its component parts are in greatest part deductive. General principlesare expanded and from these the economists try and have tried to advance arguments for protection, for free trade or against protection and free trade. The relations of imports to exports; invisible and visible balances of international debts or payments; the doctrine of comparative costs---all these and more are arrived at mainly through reasoning from general postulates. (1) [...]

thesis.subject: Economics.
Tariff -- Canada.

thesis.title: Some aspects of the Canadian tariff and tariff-making since 1918 : protection: and the Canadian cotton yarn and cloth and woollen cloth industries.

thesis.description: In this paper a number of band-pass circuits will be treated from a theoretical and technical point of view. Certain inaccuracies in the literature dealing with coupled circuits (B2B, B29) having caught the attention of the author, most of the space of this treatise will be allotted to the derivation of a relationship between the "peak separation", coupling coefficient and circuit resistance. The band-pass circuit will be considered as a part of the receiver. The standard methods of coupling, as summed up by G.W.O.H (editorialExperimental Wireless & Wireless Engineer,1931) (BI7), Loftin and White (Bl3) and Cohen (BIB) shall be treated and reduced to equivalent additive coupling coefficients, easily susceptible to calculation. [...]
thesis.creator: Jaderholm, Henrik Wilhelm.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Notes on the design of band-pass filters.

thesis.description: Inorganic oxidation has been studied systematically since Lavoisier's researches on combustion. The various types of reaction, which are considered as oxidation processes, have been given very satisfactory explanations, and their theoretical significance is well understood. The original oxidation was a reaction between oxygen and another element or a compound. The product had a higher proportion of oxygen than the initial material. There are certain reactions by which the proportion of some other negative element in a compound can be increased. [...]
thesis.creator: Horwood, James Francis.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Studies in organic oxidation.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: COLD as a means of preservation of perishable substances is one of the oldest methods in use. Probably discovered purely by accident, it has been used for thousands of years in various forms, although the reasons and principles of its efficacy were little known. "Natural refrigeration",(such as cold climates, winter temperatures, submerging of products in cold springs or running streams, storage in cool caves and cellars, and cooling by evaporation in porous vessels), is the most primitive method used from prehistoric times down to our own. [...]
thesis.creator: Hess, Ernest.
thesis.subject: Cold -- Physiological effect.
Bacteriology.
Bacteria -- Physiology.
thesis.title: Effects of sub-optimal temperatures on marine bacteria.

thesis.description: Chromatids were traced throughout the chromosome configurations in the first meiotic division in Melanoplus femur-rubrum. Chromosome configurations were studied in relation to the different hypotheses concerning the interpretation of chiasmata and the mechanism of chromosome pairing. A ratio of 7l compensating to 35 non-compensating chiasmata was found.Cytological interference was demonstrated. Chiasma frequencies were determined and a reduction in frequency was shown to be due to terminalisation rather than to breaks at chiasmata. Terminal associations were demonstrated to arise from earlier interstitial chiasmata. Movement of chiasmata was shown to be, in some cases, towards the spindle attachment. This is discussed in relation to recent hypotheses concerning the movement of chiasmata. The interpretation of certain configurations was found impossible on the ~classical" hypothesis. In a heteromorphic bivalent, the one chiasma formed must have been the result of previous crossing-over. The greater frequency or asymmetrical arrangements of chromatids is in accord with the "partial chiasmatypy hypothesis". A greater degree of contraction of chromosomes was found at metaphase in the spermatogonial divisions than atmetaphase in the first meiotic division, which is not in accord with Darlingtont's precocity theory of meiosis.
thesis.creator: Hearne, Edna M.
thesis.subject: Meiosis.
Melanoplus femur-rubrum.
Botany.
thesis.title: Chromosome studies on the mechanism of meiosis in Melanoplus femur-rubrum.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Although the Black River group has received thorough study in the region of the Lower Ottawa Valley and in New York State, a detailed stratigraphic analysis of it, as it occurs in the immediate vicinity of Montreal has not, up to the present, been made. The boundaries of the formations here constituting the group, have never been definitely fixed, nor have the strata comprising these formations been adequately described or analysed. This situation may be attributed· to the lack of previous interest in this district as well as to the fact that the group is more fully developed in the above mentioned localities. [...]
thesis.creator: Harris, Julius Jack.
thesis.subject: Geology.
thesis.title: The Black River group in the vicinity of Montreal.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The heat capacities of gelatin gels, prepared from ash-free gelatin, of cocentrations ranging from 9% to lOO% gelatin and over the range of temperature between -180° and 25°C.,have been measured. The adiabatic calorimeter used permits a much higher degree of accuracy than has been previously attained in such measurements. Such previous measurements as have been made on gelatin gels cover a mnch more restricted range of temperature and concentration, and have not been made on pure materials. [...]

thesis.title: The heat capacity of gelatin gels.

thesis.description: The English literature of these provinces begins with the coming, about 1760, of the New England immigrants, who brought with them their own traditions, with their subsequentinfluence. With the Loyalists (1783) came the influence of the late 17th and early 18th century English writers. An attempt is made to show why Loyalist influence upon literature and education ~as not greater. The Pre Confederation period is a discussion of the works of Haliburton and Howe, both in regard to literary value and to public affairs. The Post-Confederation period, in which a definite national sentiment is evident, is represented almost entirely by poetry. Robert Norwood is considered both as poet and dramatist. There is a brief discussion of contemporary prose and poetry and the trends are shown. The thesis includes only those writers who have received wide recognition and whose influence has been definite. [...]
thesis.creator: Hagerman, Verna Blanche.
thesis.subject: English.
thesis.title: The English literature of the maritime provinces of Canada : influences and trends.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The requisites of a sound system of social economy are maximum production and the most equitable distribution of wealth consistent with it. It is the contention of the writer that no radical departure from the present economic organization which is based on the individual's pursuit of profit as the main economic motive - is necessary to secure this. The outstanding impediment to the realization of maximum production is seen to be industrial depressions and the enforced idleness they cause. An analysis of depressions reveals that price stabilization holds the key to the solution. But the present technique of regulation cannot control the price level and the attempt is made to show how any desired level can be maintained under all conditions. It is shown that the control of the price level can be used to effect a redistribution of wealth. [...]
thesis.creator: Brenhouse, Samuel Ervin Maitland.
thesis.subject: Economics.
thesis.title: The control of the profit system.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis is the report on the results of work undertaken to find the methods best adapted to the determination of the distribution of the valuable metals in the minerals of an ore. The carriers of the noble metals, particularly gold, are a problem difficult of solution, but of very great commercial import. The ore from the Noranda Mine was chosen for study. It is a gold bearing ore with an admixture of other minerals. A knowledge of the distribution of the gold between native gold, tellurides, and solid solution or fine distribution through other minerals, would give the limits beyond which further dressing of the ore would be unprofitable, and might give a clue to new provisions that would make for a greater recovery of gold: also a more effective recovery of other minerals. [...]
thesis.creator: Denis, Frank Theophile.
thesis.subject: Geology.
thesis.title: An investigation of the mineral composition of the ores of Noranda mines Ltd.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Metals and ketals are characterized by the grouping R-O-C-O-R, and are thus closely related to the class of compounds known as ethers. In chemical behaviour, however, theydiffer from the ethers, being readily susceptible to hydrolysis in a dilute acid medium. In alkaline solution, on the other hand, they are as inert as the ethers. An acetal may be regarded most conveniently as essentially the product of the condensation of an aldehyde with an alcohol, although it may not necessarily be prepared in this manner. Similarly a ketal may be considered as the condensation product of a ketone with an alcohol. [...]
thesis.creator: Hallonquist, Earland Grand.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Synthesis, structure and properties of cyclic and bicyclic acetals.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The purpose of this thesis is to describe the fall in the value and volume of Canada's exports since the outset of the present depression, and to investigate the economic effects upon Canada of that fall. In Part One of the thesis, describing the fall in the value and volume of exports, the significance of Canada's export trade to her economic welfare will be shown, and the importance of exports to particular countries will be considered, as well as the importance of exports of particular commodities. In Part Two of the thesis, investigating the economic effects upon Canada of the fall in exports, the three chief consequences will be dealt with. These are, first, the decrease in value and volume+of production of commodities intended for export; second, the decline in employment and wages of workers engaged in producing those commodities; and third, the drop of price in Canada of commodities a large part of whichlare normally exported but now, although their production may have diminished in volume, remain at home insufficient quantity to over-supply the home market. The period of time over which the studies in this thesis are made extends from 1929, the year in which the depression first came to be seriously felt in Canada, toNovember 15, 1932, on which date the tariffs resulting from the Imperial Conferenoe at ottawa became effective.
thesis.creator: Greenlees, Stephen.
thesis.subject: Economics.
Exports -- Canada.
thesis.title: The Canadian export trade and the depression.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

From the consideration of these theories, liquefaction of metallic catalysts should be aooompanied by the disappearance of the "active patches", whether these are regarded as the "active points" postulated by Taylor, or as the crystalline imperfections and the intercrystalline interstices, as assumed by Schwab and others. [...]

thesis.description: One of the best ways of discovering the world-view of an age is to note the recurrent problems of its philosophers. To the ancient Greeks the ideal of the philosopher was to be a spectator of all time and all existence; among the moderns the ideal is the same - to envisage things sub specie aeterntatis, with Spinoza, to attain the spirit of wholeness, with the modern idealists. Even the various contemporary empirical philosophies, pragmatism, instrumentalism, humanism, naturalism, though they reject such phrases as these in their description of the role of philosophy, assert nevertheless that they take all knowledge and all experience as their province. [...]
thesis.creator: Currie, Cecil.
thesis.subject: Philosophy.
Kant, Immanuel, 1724-1804.
Hume, David, 1711-1776.
Causation -- History -- 18th century.

thesis.title: Time, continuity, and contingency : an historical study.

thesis.description: Tetraphenylcyclopentadienone can be used as one of the components in the diene synthesis. Products are described resulting from the addition of maleic anhydride, maleic, fumaric, and acetylene dicarboxylic esters, and benzoyl phenylacetylene. In some instances the primary addition products containing a carbonyl bridge (hexendones) could be isolated. Tetraphenylbenzene derivatives result from secondary reactions. Neither benzalacetophenone, dibenzoylethylene nor diphenylketene added to tetraphenylcyclopentadlenone. [...]

thesis.description: Experiments have been carried out in guinea pigs to demonstrate that hyperplasia of the thyroid gland and reversion to the colloid phase could be induced by subtotal extirpation ofthe thyroid gland and partial tracheostenosis. This reversion was observed in the thyroid remnants of the neck; also, in another series of experiments, reversion to the colloid phase took place in the neck remnants and autotransplants. It was concluded that the changes so produced must be due to a bloodborne factor. A "cyclic hypothesis" of thyroidphysiology was presented, in which it was stated that the body requirements for thyroxin, the thyreotropic hormone and anti-thyreotropic substance, and the mobilization of iodine in the thyroid gland are all interrelated. On this basis the sequence of events due to subtotal thyroidectomy and after partial tracheostenosis was explained. [...]
thesis.creator: Workman, E. Walter.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: The effect of partial tracheal occlusion on thecompensatory hypertrophy of autotransplants and remnants of the thyroid gland.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A lignin oomparatively free from carbohydrate has been isolated in high yields from birch woodmeal by extraction with formic acid~ln the absence of any catalyst, and the properties of this isolated formic acid lignin investigated. The application of the Grignard machine to the study of lignins and the prediction of the exiStence of specific groups in these substances have been investigated and the limitations of its usefulness defined. Evidence has been obtained for the existence in birch wood of a ohemically combined lignin-carbohydrate complex.

thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The Structure of Lignin and its relation to other plant constituents
